newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Australia says received EU wheat subsidy assurance.
newsitem.headline: Australia says received EU wheat subsidy assurance.

text.p: Australian Primary Industries and Energy Minister John Anderson said on Wednesday that the European Commission had given him assurances over grain export subsidies.

"They have made it plain to us they don't desire another battle with the Americans over this issue and they will seek to minimise that programme and its impact on countries like Australia," Anderson told a news briefing.

Anderson, speaking after what he described as "very constructive" talks with EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler, noted that EU wheat export subsidies were considerably reduced last week in response to rising prices.

"That's a formula we can only support and we hope that grain prices continue to recover," he said, adding that he could not understand why wheat prices had fallen so sharply given that world stocks were still tight.
Asked about cut-price Argentine wheat exports, Anderson said he thought that this "trade-distorting" impact would soon disappear once the Argentine harvest was over.
A European Commission spokesman reiterated that EU policy was to follow world grain market trends.
"This was shown by the lowering of EU grain export subsidies last week," the spokesman said. --Peter Blackburn Brussels Bureau +322 287 6830
